resources.string: This app is to assist you to register for COVID-19 Vaccine and orientate you with the details necessary before proceeding with the registration process
Sorry you not qualify to register for this Vaccine!
Are you Healthy and Certain that you are NOT having any history of severe allergies Or any medical illness\?
Do you understand that this vaccine does NOT fully guarantee you of not getting a COVID-19 infection in the future\?
Do you understand that taking this vaccine may cause reactions and side effects as described in the vaccine information\?
Are you willing to take this vaccine and ready to complete the total dose intake as scheduled\?

COVID SHIELD
 
MINISTRY OF HEALTH INDIA 
01 WHAT IS COVID-19\?
 
COVID-19 disease is caused by a coronavirus called SARS-CoV-2. Symptoms may appear 2 to 14 days after exposure to the virus. Symptoms that may be experienced are:
 • Fever or chills
 • Cough
 • Difficulty breathing
 • Fatigue
 • Muscle or body pain
 • Headache
 • Loss of sense of taste or smell
 • Sore throat
 • Congestion or runny nose
 • Nausea or vomiting
 • Diarrhea
 
 02 WHO IS AT HIGH RISK FOR GETTING COVID-19 INFECTION\? 
The risk groups are:
 • Children
 • Senior citizens aged 60 and above
 • Patients with chronic diseases
 • Patients with low immunity
 • Pregnant women
 
Covidshield is one of the Covid-19 vaccines that has been approved for emergency
 
use in India and several other countries. It is manufactured by the Serum Institute of India (SII),
 
which is the world's largest vaccine producer by volume. Covidshield is based on the viral vector
 
technology developed by Oxford University and AstraZeneca, a British-Swedish pharmaceutical company.
 
Covidshield works by introducing a modified version of a common cold virus (adenovirus) that contains 
 
the genetic material of the spike protein of the novel coronavirus. The spike protein is what the coronavirus
 
uses to attach to human cells and infect them. When the vaccine is injected into a person, it triggers an immune
 
response that produces antibodies against the spike protein. These antibodies can then prevent the coronavirus from
 
entering the cells and causing Covid-19.


Covidshield has been shown to be safe and effective in preventing symptomatic and severe Covid-19 across diverse populations, 
 
including older adults. According to a large phase 3 clinical trial published in the New England Journal of Medicine in December
 
2021, Covidshield had an efficacy of 70.4% against symptomatic Covid-19 and 100% against severe Covid-19 and hospitalization.
 
The vaccine also demonstrated high effectiveness against various variants of the coronavirus, such as the alpha and delta variants,
 
which are more contagious and virulent than the original strain.


Covidshield requires two doses given at an interval of 4 to 12 weeks for optimal protection. The vaccine can be stored at 2 to 8 degrees 
 
Celsius, which makes it suitable for distribution in low-resource settings. The vaccine is also affordable, costing around $3 per 
 
dose for low- and middle-income countries.


Covidshield is a vital tool in the global fight against the Covid-19 pandemic, which has claimed over 5 million lives and infected over
 
250 million people worldwide. By getting vaccinated with Covidshield or any other authorized vaccine, people can protect themselves and
 
others from this deadly disease and help end the health crisis.

COVAXIN
 
MINISTRY OF HEALTH INDIA 
01 WHAT IS COVID-19\?
 
COVID-19 disease is caused by a coronavirus called SARS-CoV-2. Symptoms may appear 2 to 14 days after exposure to the virus. Symptoms that may be experienced are:
 • Fever or chills
 • Cough
 • Difficulty breathing
 • Fatigue
 • Muscle or body pain
 • Headache
 • Loss of sense of taste or smell
 • Sore throat
 • Congestion or runny nose
 • Nausea or vomiting
 • Diarrhea
 
 02 WHO IS AT HIGH RISK FOR GETTING COVID-19 INFECTION\? 
The risk groups are:
 • Children
 • Senior citizens aged 60 and above
 • Patients with chronic diseases
 • Patients with low immunity
 • Pregnant women
 
03 WHAT IS THE IMPORTANCE OF TAKING COVID 19 VACCINE\? 
The COVID-19 vaccine is given to control the transmission of COVID-19 disease. As more people get vaccinated, more and more people form antibodies and in turn reduce the likelihood of more severe COVID-19 disease. Indirectly it can protect at -risk groups who are not eligible for vaccination.
 
Covaxin is a COVID-19 vaccine developed by Bharat Biotech in India. 
 It is based on an inactivated form of the coronavirus that cannot
 cause disease but can trigger an immune response. 
 Covaxin has been approved for emergency use in India and several Other countries
 
According to the results of a phase 3 clinical trial with 25,798 participants in India,
 
Covaxin has an overall efficacy of 77.8% against symptomatic COVID-19. This means that it
 
reduces the risk of developing symptoms
 
by 77.8% compared to a placebo. The vaccine also has an efficacy of 93.4% against severe COVID-19,
 
meaning that it reduces the risk
 of hospitalization or death by 93.4%. Moreover, Covaxin has an efficacy
 
of 65.2% against the Delta variant, which is the dominant strain
 
in India and many other countries.

Pfizer-BioNTech
 
COVID-19 COMIRNATY VACCINE INFORMATION (PFIZER-BIONTECH COMPANY) FOR VACCINE RECIPIENTS
 
WHAT IS COVID-19 \? 
COVID-19 disease is caused by a coronavirus called SARS-CoV-2. Symptoms may appear 2 to 14 days after exposure to the virus. Symptoms that may be experienced are:
 • Fever or chills
 • Cough
 • Difficulty breathing
 • Fatigue
 • Loss of sense of taste or smell
 • Sore throat
 • Congestion or runny nose
 • Nausea or vomiting
 • Diarrhea
 • Muscle or body pain
 • Headache
 
 The risk groups are:
 • Children
 • Senior citizens aged 60 and above
 • Patients with chronic diseases
 • Patients with low immunity
 • Pregnant women
 
WHAT IS THE IMPORTANCE OF TAKING COVID 19 VACCINE\? 
The COVID-19 vaccine is given to control the transmission of COVID-19 disease. As more people get vaccinated, more and more people form antibodies and in turn reduce the likelihood of more severe COVID-19 disease. Indirectly it can protect at -risk groups who are not eligible for vaccination.


The Sputnik V COVID-19 vaccine is one of the vaccines that have been approved for emergency use in several countries around the world. It was developed by the Gamaleya Research Institute of Epidemiology and Microbiology in Russia, and it is based on a viral vector platform.


The vaccine uses two different adenoviruses, which are common viruses that cause colds and other mild infections, as vectors to deliver the genetic material of the coronavirus spike protein into human cells. The spike protein is what the coronavirus uses to attach to and infect cells, and by exposing the immune system to it, the vaccine aims to trigger a protective response.


The vaccine requires two doses, administered 21 days apart, and it can be stored at 2-8°C, which makes it easier to distribute than some other vaccines that require ultra-cold storage. According to the interim results of a phase 3 trial published in The Lancet, the vaccine has an efficacy of 91.6% against symptomatic COVID-19, and it also appears to be safe and well-tolerated.


 However, some experts have raised questions about the quality and transparency of the data, as well as the speed and rigor of the regulatory approval process in Russia and other countries. The vaccine has also been subject to political controversies and misinformation campaigns, which may affect public trust and acceptance.


The World Health Organization (WHO) and the European Medicines Agency (EMA) are currently reviewing the vaccine for possible authorization. If approved, the vaccine could play an important role in increasing global vaccine supply and equity, as well as helping to end the pandemic.
Your First dose Appointment has been set to:
Sorry, Your Registration is unsuccessful, try again
Unsuccessful Registration, this email is already used.
Unsuccessful Registration, Adhaar number is already used.

STAY HOME, STAY SAFE, CORONAVIRUS IS REAL, PROTECT YOURSELF AND YOUR FAMILY. REMEMBER YOUR APPOINTMENT DATE AND ENCOURAGE YOUR FRIENDS AND FAMILY TO TAKE THE VACCINE...DO NOT HESITATE TO CONTACT THE NEAREST HOSPITAL IF YOU NOTICE ANY CORONAVIRUS SYMPTOMS

Coronaviruses are a group of related RNA viruses that cause diseases in mammals and birds. In humans and birds, they cause respiratory tract infections that can range from mild to lethal. The most recent coronavirus disease is COVID-19. It is an infectious disease caused by the SARS-CoV-2 virus. Most people infected with the virus will experience mild to moderate respiratory illness and recover without requiring special treatment. However, some will become seriously ill and require medical attention.
How do I make an appointment\?

Your appointment will be made once you have completed the questionnaire by visiting the Dashboard and click on any vaccine you want to register. Your answers to the quiz will determine whether you will be able to proceed with the vaccine registration and an appointment will be scheduled after successful registration. You can then Login to check if any changes occur.
What should I do if my current location is not available\?
Login, and click on List of vaccine administration and you can see the nearest location near you
Are there any hotline numbers I can call to find out more about the COVID-19 vaccination registration\?
Go to Dashboard and click on the Vaccine hotline Number and you can dial it directly on this app once you click it
I have registered for vaccination. What Next\?

Vaccination candidates will receive confirmation of date and assigned Vaccination Distribution Centre PPV two weeks before their scheduled appointment. Within the two weeks, candidates will also get reminders via phone call or SMS.
When will I know all appointment details\?

Vaccination candidates will receive confirmation of date and assigned Vaccination Distribution Centre PPV two weeks before their scheduled appointment. Within the two weeks, candidates will also get reminders via phone call or SMS.
What is comorbidity and how will I know if I have it\?

Comorbidity is when an individual has preExisting health conditions like high blood pressure, diabetes, heart disease, kidney disease, liver disease, low immunity, asthma, cancer, chronic lung disease, stroke or obesity. Comorbidity can only be certified by qualified medical professionals.
I have high blood pressure and high cholesterol but it is under control and I need no medication. Does that mean I have comorbidity\?
Please consult a qualified medical professional to determine your current comorbidity status.
I recently underwent a surgery to remove a growth. Does that mean I have comorbidity\?
Yes. Although the growth has been removed, you are still considered to have comorbidity.
